meanings.definition: To cut or shape the end of something into a small, rounded knob or protuberance.
meanings.sent1: She carefully nubbed the pencil to make it easier to hold.
meanings.sent2: He nubbed the wood to create a decorative finish.
meanings.sent3: The artist nubbed the clay into a cute little animal shape.
meanings.sent4: The tailor nubbed the fabric, giving it a unique texture.
meanings.sent5: The gardener nubbed the plant stems for a whimsical look.

meanings.definition: Having a small, rounded knob or protuberance at the end.
meanings.sent1: The nubbed handle provided a comfortable grip.
meanings.sent3: The nubbed edges of the puzzle piece made it easy to handle.
meanings.sent4: The nubbed texture of the fabric added a tactile element.
meanings.sent5: The nubbed design on the phone case was both stylish and functional.
